{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Marketing Officer (Entry Level)",
  "description": "Integrated Health Care Limited is a limited liability company incorporated to carry out the business of health management services. The company with RC No 372504 was incorporated in 2000 by the Corporate Affairs Commission, Abuja under the Companies and Allied Matters Act, 1990. Our over 21 years experience and a skilled workforce have positioned us as HMO of choice as we have consistently delivered quality health care services to our clients all over the Country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Officer&nbsp;(Entry Level)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	A First Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, or a related field
	1 - 3 years of experience in marketing, preferably in a healthcare or insurance setting.
	Industry Knowledge (Desirable): Knowledge of HMO operations and healthcare systems is an added advantage.


Core Competencies:


	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficiency in digital marketing tools, social media platforms, and content management systems.
	Basic knowledge of SEO, Google Analytics, email marketing tools, and relevant software.
	Creative thinking and strong attention to detail.
	Teamwork and collaboration.
	Empathy and professionalism.
	Organizational and time management skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers.abuja@yahoo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Marketing Officer (Entry Level) Job at Integrated Health Care Limited




        
    

        
        Integrated Health Care Limited is a limited liability company incorporated to carry out the business of health management services. The company with RC No 372504 was incorporated in 2000 by the Corporate Affairs Commission, Abuja under the Companies and Allied Matters Act, 1990. Our over 21 years experience and a skilled workforce have positioned us as HMO of choice as we have consistently delivered quality health care services to our clients all over the Country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Officer (Entry Level)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	A First Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, or a related field
	1 - 3 years of experience in marketing, preferably in a healthcare or insurance setting.
	Industry Knowledge (Desirable): Knowledge of HMO operations and healthcare systems is an added advantage.


Core Competencies:


	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficiency in digital marketing tools, social media platforms, and content management systems.
	Basic knowledge of SEO, Google Analytics, email marketing tools, and relevant software.
	Creative thinking and strong attention to detail.
	Teamwork and collaboration.
	Empathy and professionalism.
	Organizational and time management skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers.abuja@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Supply Chain Officer",
  "description": "MagikWorld was founded in 2013 with the vision of transforming the way people celebrate life&rsquo;s meaningful moments. Since its inception, the company has grown to become a leading gifting services brand in Nigeria, with offices in Lagos, Abuja, and Ile-Ife, and its head office in Abuja, FCT. From humble beginnings of curating thoughtful gift boxes for individuals, MagikWorld has evolved into a full-service gifting company catering to both individuals and corporate organizations. Over the years, it has built a reputation for creativity, innovation, and reliability, consistently delivering unique gifting experiences that delight customers and foster lasting connections.&nbsp;Today, MagikWorld is recognized not only for the quality and originality of its gifts, but also for its ability to reduce stress for customers by providing end-to-end gifting solutions &mdash; from sourcing, packaging, customization, to delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Gwarinpa, Abuja (FCT)
Work Schedule: 5 days on (live in company accommodation) &ndash; 5 days off

Role Overview


	MagikWorld Global Services is seeking a proactive and organized Supply Chain Officer to join our operations team in Gwarinpa, Abuja.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for sourcing and purchasing company materials, managing stock inventory, coordinating logistics, and ensuring the efficient flow of goods and supplies.
	This role is essential in maintaining smooth operations and supporting both office and customer supply needs.


Responsibilities
Procurement &amp; Sourcing:


	Identify and source quality materials, equipment, and supplies needed by the company.
	Negotiate with vendors and suppliers to obtain the best prices and delivery terms.
	Ensure timely procurement of approved items while maintaining budget discipline.


Inventory &amp; Store Management:


	Maintain accurate records of stock in the company&rsquo;s store.
	Track goods received and issued, and ensure proper documentation.
	Conduct periodic stock checks and reconcile inventory discrepancies.
	Keep an updated record of all office assets and consumables.


Logistics Coordination:


	Coordinate logistics for delivery of supplied items to the office and project sites.
	Assist in organizing logistics for customer deliveries as needed.
	Ensure safe handling, storage, and transportation of materials.


Reporting &amp; Control:


	Prepare regular reports on inventory levels, procurement activities, and logistics operations.
	Maintain strong internal controls to prevent stock losses or misuse.
	Support management in planning and optimizing the supply chain process.


Requirements


	OND/HND/B.Sc. in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	1&ndash;3 years of experience in supply chain, logistics, or storekeeping roles.
	Strong understanding of inventory control and procurement procedures.
	Good negotiation, organizational, and record-keeping skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and basic inventory management tools.
	High level of integrity, accountability, and attention to detail.
	Must reside in Abuja or be willing to live within the company&rsquo;s accommodation during on-duty periods.


Salary
N80,000 Monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their&nbsp;CV/ Resume to:&nbsp;Magikworldvacancies@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-07",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-15",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "MagikWorld"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",

    }

}



Supply Chain Officer Job at MagikWorld




        
    

        
        
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

MagikWorld was founded in 2013 with the vision of transforming the way people celebrate life’s meaningful moments. Since its inception, the company has grown to become a leading gifting services brand in Nigeria, with offices in Lagos, Abuja, and Ile-Ife, and its head office in Abuja, FCT. From humble beginnings of curating thoughtful gift boxes for individuals, MagikWorld has evolved into a full-service gifting company catering to both individuals and corporate organizations. Over the years, it has built a reputation for creativity, innovation, and reliability, consistently delivering unique gifting experiences that delight customers and foster lasting connections. Today, MagikWorld is recognized not only for the quality and originality of its gifts, but also for its ability to reduce stress for customers by providing end-to-end gifting solutions — from sourcing, packaging, customization, to delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain Officer
Job Location: Gwarinpa, Abuja (FCT)
Work Schedule: 5 days on (live in company accommodation) – 5 days off

Role Overview


	MagikWorld Global Services is seeking a proactive and organized Supply Chain Officer to join our operations team in Gwarinpa, Abuja.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for sourcing and purchasing company materials, managing stock inventory, coordinating logistics, and ensuring the efficient flow of goods and supplies.
	This role is essential in maintaining smooth operations and supporting both office and customer supply needs.


Responsibilities
Procurement & Sourcing:


	Identify and source quality materials, equipment, and supplies needed by the company.
	Negotiate with vendors and suppliers to obtain the best prices and delivery terms.
	Ensure timely procurement of approved items while maintaining budget discipline.


Inventory & Store Management:


	Maintain accurate records of stock in the company’s store.
	Track goods received and issued, and ensure proper documentation.
	Conduct periodic stock checks and reconcile inventory discrepancies.
	Keep an updated record of all office assets and consumables.


Logistics Coordination:


	Coordinate logistics for delivery of supplied items to the office and project sites.
	Assist in organizing logistics for customer deliveries as needed.
	Ensure safe handling, storage, and transportation of materials.


Reporting & Control:


	Prepare regular reports on inventory levels, procurement activities, and logistics operations.
	Maintain strong internal controls to prevent stock losses or misuse.
	Support management in planning and optimizing the supply chain process.


Requirements


	OND/HND/B.Sc. in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	1–3 years of experience in supply chain, logistics, or storekeeping roles.
	Strong understanding of inventory control and procurement procedures.
	Good negotiation, organizational, and record-keeping skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and basic inventory management tools.
	High level of integrity, accountability, and attention to detail.
	Must reside in Abuja or be willing to live within the company’s accommodation during on-duty periods.


Salary
N80,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV/ Resume to: Magikworldvacancies@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Manager, Mechanical",
  "description": "Dangote Group is one of Nigeria&rsquo;s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard &ndash; earned reputation for excellent business practices and products&rsquo; quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Manager, Mechanical

Job Location:&nbsp;Ibese, Ogun

Job Description


	Are you an accomplished Mechanical Engineer with a strong track record in the cement industry? Dangote Cement Plc. is seeking a Manager, Mechanical to lead the maintenance and operational reliability of our mechanical systems across the plant.
	In this leadership role, you will oversee the performance, maintenance, and continuous improvement of key mechanical assets&mdash;including crushers, mills, conveyors, and kilns.
	Your technical expertise and strategic oversight will be critical in optimizing equipment reliability, minimizing downtime, and enhancing plant efficiency.
	If you are a results-driven professional with strong leadership skills and a passion for engineering excellence, we invite you to join our team and contribute to building Africa&rsquo;s leading cement brand.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide strategic leadership for the mechanical maintenance team to ensure optimal performance and reliability of plant equipment.
	Oversee maintenance, inspection, and repair activities for critical mechanical systems such as crushers, kilns, mills, and conveyors.
	Develop, implement, and monitor preventive and predictive maintenance programs to ensure consistent operational performance.
	Analyze equipment performance data, identify root causes of failures, and implement corrective and improvement actions.
	Coordinate mechanical maintenance during plant shutdowns and major overhauls.
	Ensure strict adherence to safety, health, and environmental regulations in all maintenance operations.
	Manage spare parts inventory, maintenance budgets, and resource allocation for mechanical activities.
	Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance equipment efficiency, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.
	Mentor and develop engineers and technicians to strengthen team capability and performance.


Requirements


	Education: B.Sc. or HND in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline.
	Experience: Minimum of 18 years of relevant experience in mechanical maintenance and operations within the cement or heavy process industry.
	Proven experience in a managerial or leadership role with strong team coordination and decision-making skills.
	Deep technical understanding of mechanical systems and processes in cement production.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to manage complex maintenance challenges.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills.
	Sound knowledge of HSE regulations, reliability engineering, and maintenance best practices.

Manager, Mechanical Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Manager, Mechanical

Job Location: Ibese, Ogun

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Are you an accomplished Mechanical Engineer with a strong track record in the cement industry? Dangote Cement Plc. is seeking a Manager, Mechanical to lead the maintenance and operational reliability of our mechanical systems across the plant.
	In this leadership role, you will oversee the performance, maintenance, and continuous improvement of key mechanical assets—including crushers, mills, conveyors, and kilns.
	Your technical expertise and strategic oversight will be critical in optimizing equipment reliability, minimizing downtime, and enhancing plant efficiency.
	If you are a results-driven professional with strong leadership skills and a passion for engineering excellence, we invite you to join our team and contribute to building Africa’s leading cement brand.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide strategic leadership for the mechanical maintenance team to ensure optimal performance and reliability of plant equipment.
	Oversee maintenance, inspection, and repair activities for critical mechanical systems such as crushers, kilns, mills, and conveyors.
	Develop, implement, and monitor preventive and predictive maintenance programs to ensure consistent operational performance.
	Analyze equipment performance data, identify root causes of failures, and implement corrective and improvement actions.
	Coordinate mechanical maintenance during plant shutdowns and major overhauls.
	Ensure strict adherence to safety, health, and environmental regulations in all maintenance operations.
	Manage spare parts inventory, maintenance budgets, and resource allocation for mechanical activities.
	Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance equipment efficiency, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.
	Mentor and develop engineers and technicians to strengthen team capability and performance.


Requirements


	Education: B.Sc. or HND in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline.
	Experience: Minimum of 18 years of relevant experience in mechanical maintenance and operations within the cement or heavy process industry.
	Proven experience in a managerial or leadership role with strong team coordination and decision-making skills.
	Deep technical understanding of mechanical systems and processes in cement production.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to manage complex maintenance challenges.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills.
	Sound knowledge of HSE regulations, reliability engineering, and maintenance best practices.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Videographer & Content Creator",
  "description": "DreamCity Property &amp; Investment Limited remains at the vanguard of residential and commercial real estate development across major cities in Nigeria delivering reliable structures with qualified infrastructure, luxury apartments in highbrow cities, and commercial real estate with good returns for our investors, who have over time become part of our success story.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Videographer &amp; Content Creator
Job Location:&nbsp;Jabi, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a talented and dynamic Videographer with a keen eye for detail and a passion for real estate.
	You will be responsible for the entire video production lifecycle&mdash;from concept to delivery&mdash;creating compelling video content that showcases our properties, builds our brand, and engages our target audience across multiple platforms.
	The ideal candidate is a creative storyteller who understands how to make a property look its absolute best.


Key Responsibilities


	End-to-End Video Production: Manage all aspects of video production for property listings, including pre-production planning, on-location filming, and post-production editing.
	Create Immersive Content: Produce a variety of high-quality video content, including property walkthroughs, cinematic teasers, neighborhood highlights, and agent profile videos.
	Execute Advanced Shooting Techniques: Utilize drone footage (where legally compliant), gimbal stabilization, time-lapses, and HDR photography/videography to create dynamic and immersive visual experiences.
	Expert Video and Graphic Editing: Edit raw footage into polished, engaging, and brand-consistent videos for use on our website, social media, online listings, and email marketing campaigns.
	Graphic Design &amp; Motion Graphics: Create and incorporate lower-thirds, logos, transitions, maps, and simple motion graphics to enhance video storytelling and brand recognition.
	Sound Design and Color Grading: Enhance videos with professional audio mixing (music, voice-overs, sound effects) and perform color correction/grading to ensure a consistent, high-end visual style.
	Equipment and Asset Management: Maintain, manage, and operate all video, audio, and lighting equipment. Organize and archive all video footage and project files.
	Collaborate with Business Development&amp; Sales: Work closely with the marketing team and real estate agents to develop creative concepts that align with marketing strategies and sales goals for each property.
	Optimize for Digital Platforms: Tailor video content and format for different platforms (e.g., YouTube, Instagram Reels, TikTok, Facebook) to maximize reach and engagement.
	Stay Current with Trends: Continuously research and implement the latest trends in real estate videography, editing styles, and social media content to keep our brand at the forefront.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Educational Background: A Diploma or Degree in Videography, Film Production, Media Studies, Graphic Design, or a related field is preferred.
	Core Experience: A minimum of 3 years of professional experience in videography, video editing, and graphic design.
	Industry Experience: Proven experience creating video content specifically for the real estate industry is a mandatory requirement. A strong portfolio demonstrating this is essential.
	Technical Proficiency: Expert-level proficiency in video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro) and the Adobe Creative Suite (especially After Effects, Photoshop, and Illustrator).
	Equipment Expertise: Hands-on experience with professional cameras (DSLR/Mirrorless), operating drones, gimbals, lighting, and audio recording equipment.
	Creative &amp; Artistic Eye: A strong portfolio showcasing a keen eye for composition, lighting, storytelling, and visual aesthetics, with a focus on creating an emotional connection.
	Soft Skills: Excellent time-management skills, the ability to work independently and under tight deadlines, and superb communication and collaboration skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment.office@dreamcityproperty.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

Note:&nbsp;Candidates must provide a link to their online portfolio or showreel demonstrating relevant real estate work.",

Videographer & Content Creator Job at DreamCity Property & Investment Limited




        
    

        
        DreamCity Property & Investment Limited remains at the vanguard of residential and commercial real estate development across major cities in Nigeria delivering reliable structures with qualified infrastructure, luxury apartments in highbrow cities, and commercial real estate with good returns for our investors, who have over time become part of our success story.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Videographer & Content Creator
Job Location: Jabi, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a talented and dynamic Videographer with a keen eye for detail and a passion for real estate.
	You will be responsible for the entire video production lifecycle—from concept to delivery—creating compelling video content that showcases our properties, builds our brand, and engages our target audience across multiple platforms.
	The ideal candidate is a creative storyteller who understands how to make a property look its absolute best.


Key Responsibilities


	End-to-End Video Production: Manage all aspects of video production for property listings, including pre-production planning, on-location filming, and post-production editing.
	Create Immersive Content: Produce a variety of high-quality video content, including property walkthroughs, cinematic teasers, neighborhood highlights, and agent profile videos.
	Execute Advanced Shooting Techniques: Utilize drone footage (where legally compliant), gimbal stabilization, time-lapses, and HDR photography/videography to create dynamic and immersive visual experiences.
	Expert Video and Graphic Editing: Edit raw footage into polished, engaging, and brand-consistent videos for use on our website, social media, online listings, and email marketing campaigns.
	Graphic Design & Motion Graphics: Create and incorporate lower-thirds, logos, transitions, maps, and simple motion graphics to enhance video storytelling and brand recognition.
	Sound Design and Color Grading: Enhance videos with professional audio mixing (music, voice-overs, sound effects) and perform color correction/grading to ensure a consistent, high-end visual style.
	Equipment and Asset Management: Maintain, manage, and operate all video, audio, and lighting equipment. Organize and archive all video footage and project files.
	Collaborate with Business Development& Sales: Work closely with the marketing team and real estate agents to develop creative concepts that align with marketing strategies and sales goals for each property.
	Optimize for Digital Platforms: Tailor video content and format for different platforms (e.g., YouTube, Instagram Reels, TikTok, Facebook) to maximize reach and engagement.
	Stay Current with Trends: Continuously research and implement the latest trends in real estate videography, editing styles, and social media content to keep our brand at the forefront.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Educational Background: A Diploma or Degree in Videography, Film Production, Media Studies, Graphic Design, or a related field is preferred.
	Core Experience: A minimum of 3 years of professional experience in videography, video editing, and graphic design.
	Industry Experience: Proven experience creating video content specifically for the real estate industry is a mandatory requirement. A strong portfolio demonstrating this is essential.
	Technical Proficiency: Expert-level proficiency in video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro) and the Adobe Creative Suite (especially After Effects, Photoshop, and Illustrator).
	Equipment Expertise: Hands-on experience with professional cameras (DSLR/Mirrorless), operating drones, gimbals, lighting, and audio recording equipment.
	Creative & Artistic Eye: A strong portfolio showcasing a keen eye for composition, lighting, storytelling, and visual aesthetics, with a focus on creating an emotional connection.
	Soft Skills: Excellent time-management skills, the ability to work independently and under tight deadlines, and superb communication and collaboration skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: recruitment.office@dreamcityproperty.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

Note: Candidates must provide a link to their online portfolio or showreel demonstrating relevant real estate work.
